results.title: Living dangerously
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Reports on the explosion of a chemical factory in Seveso, Italy and the effects of the extremely toxic dust, dioxin, that was released into the atmosphere. The substance dioxin is contained in commercial weedkillers freely available in the United Kingdom.

results.title: Learning to lose
results.creator_credit: David Mills and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at criticism of the English educational system which maintains that its emphasis on theory over practical skills leaves students less employable. Shows some alternative programs which have succeeded.

results.title: Home help (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Segaller and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Brindle House in Cheshire treats people with acute psychiatric problems in an informal atmosphere, as out-patients. The staff believe that by being more accessible they are able to intervene before patients reach a critical stage. They also believe that the process of recovery is aided if the patient can remain within the community among family and friends.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Do you mind if I smoke?
results.creator_credit: Sue Woodford and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Investigates the dangers of passive smoking, ie the smoke inhaled by a non-smoker from cigarettes left burning in an ashtray or in someone’s hand. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Demonstration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An award-winning episode of the ‘World in Action’ series observing the mass protest at the U.S. embassy in London against the bombing of North Vietnam. Interviews students travelling to the rally, police preparing for the confrontation and members of the public expressing their support or opposition to the event. Captures the violent clashes between police and the crowd and records the media coverage that was transmitted by American reporters.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An award-winning episode of the ‘World in Action’ series observing the mass protest at the U.S. embassy in London against the bombing of North Vietnam. Interviews students travelling to the rally, police preparing for the confrontation and members of the public expressing their support or opposition to the event. Captures the violent clashes between police and the crowd and records the media coverage that was transmitted by American reporters.

results.title: Death by request
results.creator_credit: Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Meg Murray, an incurably ill patient, puts the case for euthanasia. Rather than spend her last days in an old persons’ home she says she will commit suicide. She discusses her attitude and views with another individual who does not agree with her.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Jafar's blue tiles (Iran)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The restoration of a 600-year-old brick dome in his village is the focal point of fourteen-year-old Jafar’s interests and activities as he is seen making and installing twelve richly colored tiles that adorn the dome. Told from Jafar’s point of view, explains the significance of the project and the brickmaking process in the culture and customs of his country and captures vistas of the Iranian landscape.

results.title: Francesco the potter (Greece)
results.creator_credit: Fred Harris, Paul Saltzman, Coronet Films and Sunrise Rilms
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
This film introduces a Greek boy who, while learning the skills of ceramics, makes a pair of cnadlesticks to present at a local church festival.

results.title: Serama's mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Saltzman and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”
Serama, a Balinese boy, has been learning the intricate, ancient art of the Balinese dance since he was seven. His teacher is his father, a master dancer. They practice for a dance that will be the father’s final performance, and mark his son as his replacement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Saltzman and Sunrise Films

results.title: Lena the glassblower: Sweden
results.creator_credit: Peter Rowe, Fred Harris, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The story of Lena, a 17-year-old girl who decides to become a glassblower against the wishes of her parents, who want her to take up tertiary education. As well as dealing positively with this conflict, the film shows many aspects of the craft of glassblowing - in particular, that carried out at the Orrefors establishment in Sweden. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
